page.title: 15Mayfield Yarns
page.content: Mayfield Mill is situated on the River Dove and occupies a twenty three and a half acre site of which five acres is production area. It is part of the Allied Textile Corporation and employs 130 men and women in the factory and offices. They process 25,000 kilos of yarn each month with customers at home and abroad. Manmade yarns come into the mill to be processed ready for customers individual uses. The first process is to "warp" the yarn. It is then returned to the customer or processed further. Japanese Tsudakuma machines are used to make yarn ready for use as computer tape and typewriter ribbon. Picnol Air Jet and water assisted machines also weave yarn. The knit-de-knit process provides a stretchy yarn ready for use in tights, socks and thermal underwear.
